content.paragraph: Each Online Group has a designated Participation Coach. The Participation Coach initiates and encourages effective participation in line with the purpose and participation protocol of the Online Group. The Participation Coach also manages publishing items to the Documents area.

All Members of an Online Group can act as Participation Coach. In fact, the more the role is shared, the better. This section of the Participation Guide is aimed at designated Participation Coaches and all Online Group Participants who wish to contribute to the success of their Online Groups.
content.heading2: The Goals of the Participation Coach
content.paragraph: The goals of the Participation Coach are defined in the Collaboration Plan for each Online Group.
The Collaboration Plan defines targets for each of the following:

bulletlist.listitem: application of that knowledge in the organisation
benefits to participants and the organisation

content.heading2: The Role of the Participation Coach

bulletlist.listitem: is the person who is most comfortable being in the Online Group
assists the other members to become as comfortable in the Online Group as they are
acts as "Keeper of the Faith" and maintains a vision of an Online Group that successfully achieves its purpose
is not a "Facilitator" of group process or leader of task-oriented activities - their focus is limited to effective participation in the Online Group

content.paragraph: When the Online Group is Starting, the Participation Coach:

bulletlist.listitem: opens the Online Group by posting the Welcome Message
leads the process of group members making introductions
assists other group members to become familiar with Basic Participation
encourages other group members to complete the Getting Started steps in the Participation Guide

content.paragraph: As participation in the Online Group gains momentum, the Participation Coach:

bulletlist.listitem: advocates for participation in the Online Group in line with its Purpose and Participation Protocol
models and encourages effective participation in the Online Group
does "house-keeping" in the Online Group such as diverging or converging "conversations" where required, summarising conversations
encourages participants to contribute items to the Documents area

content.paragraph: When the Online Group is coming to an end, the Participation Coach elicits stories that illustrate the effectiveness with which the Online Group has achieved its purpose from the Participants.
The role of Participation Coach requires some learning. In the first instance, the Participation Coach needs to learn Effective Participation themselves.
As the Online Group develops, the Participation Coach is likely to encounter challenges.
Resources available to Participation Coaches for learning and support include:

bulletlist.listitem: the Online Group itself - collaborative exploration of effective participation is one of the activities encouraged in all Online Groups
the Collaboration Plan for your Online Group has targets for Participation, Knowledge Outputs, Applications of those Outputs and Benefits to be achieved by the Online Group
Coachus - the Participation Coaches' Community of Practice
